title: Add admin-email mismatch warning banner for bootstrap admin account

requirements.text: Show an obvious, persistent warning in the authenticated UI when the logged-in user's saved profile email does not match the configured bootstrap admin email "sanjeev.vohra@gmail.com", explaining that admin rights will not be granted until the profile email is updated and saved.

quotes: If you want, I can make the UI show an obvious “You are not using the admin email” warning.

acceptanceCriteria: When a user is authenticated and `userProfile` is present and `userProfile.email` is not exactly "sanjeev.vohra@gmail.com", a prominent warning is displayed within the main app shell (visible regardless of current page).
The warning text is in English and includes: (a) the saved profile email value, and (b) the expected admin email "sanjeev.vohra@gmail.com".
The warning is not shown when `userProfile.email` is exactly "sanjeev.vohra@gmail.com" (case-sensitive match) or when the profile setup dialog is being shown because `userProfile === null`.
The warning provides a clear next step for the user to fix the issue (e.g., instruct to update and save the Profile email, and use the existing “Refresh Profile” action to re-check).

requirements.text: Add an inline hint/validation message in the Profile Setup dialog that alerts the user when they type an email other than "sanjeev.vohra@gmail.com" that they will not receive Super Admin access unless they use the admin email.

quotes: If you want, I can make the UI show an obvious “You are not using the admin email” warning.

acceptanceCriteria: In `ProfileSetupDialog`, when the Email field is non-empty and not exactly "sanjeev.vohra@gmail.com", display an English hint/warning near the Email field stating that Super Admin access requires using the admin email.
When the Email field is exactly "sanjeev.vohra@gmail.com", the hint/warning is hidden (or replaced with a neutral confirmation message).
This change does not block saving profiles for non-admin emails; it is informational only.

constraints: Do not modify any files under `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts`/`.tsx`, `frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts`, `frontend/src/main.tsx`, or anything in `frontend/src/components/ui` (immutable paths).
Keep the bootstrap admin email comparison string exactly as "sanjeev.vohra@gmail.com" (no normalization or casing changes in the UX logic).
nonGoals: Do not change backend authorization logic or the bootstrap admin rule in Motoko.
Do not add third-party authentication or email integrations.
Do not implement new admin-management workflows beyond the warning/hint UI.
